text: Sylvie Joly (18 October 1934 - 4 September 2015) was a French actress and comedian. She was best known for her roles in the movies Going Places (1974) and Get Out Your Handkerchiefs (1978). Joly was born in Paris. She had two daughters, Mathilde Vitry and St√©phane Joly. In October 2010, she revealed she had Parkinson's disease. Joly died of a heart attack on 4 September 2015 in Paris. She was 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1934 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Actors from Paris Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:French comedians Category:French movie actors Category:People with Parkinson's disease
title: Sylvie Joly
